rules.title: Sentence structure
rules.abstract: A simply sentence structure increases readability.

<cmd>Use one of a number of the available options to open the form for completion; for example, use <menu-cascade><uicontrol>File</uicontrol><uicontrol>Options</uicontrol><uicontrol>New Template</uicontrol> or choose <uicontrol>New</uicontrol> from the <uicontrol>Template</uicontrol> menu.</cmd>
<cmd>When completing the form you'll be expected to enter the values from the processed application form submitted by the candidate.</cmd>
<cmd>To save the changes you've made to the document when the option is displayed, click <uicontrol>Save</uicontrol>.</cmd>

rule.justification: The reader's attention is split between the instructions and the activity. Shorter sentences get to the point and deliver concrete instructions/information. Complex information is pulled out and presented in a table or other graphic display.
